FAQs: Addressing Common Concerns about Gynecomastia Surgery in Jaipur

Post-surgery, mild discomfort is normal and can be managed with prescribed pain medications. Rest assured, Dr. Purohit’s techniques prioritize patient comfort and aim for a smooth recovery process.

Generally, patients can expect to resume light activities within a week and gradually return to regular routines within a few weeks. Incisions are strategically placed in inconspicuous areas, and over time, scars tend to fade and become less noticeable. Following postoperative care instructions and avoiding sun exposure on incision sites can further contribute to scar fading.

5. Can I resume physical activities after surgery? Gradually resuming physical activities is recommended, but it’s essential to follow Dr. Purohit’s guidelines. Strenuous exercises should be avoided during the initial weeks to prevent complications. As healing progresses, patients can incrementally reintegrate exercise into their routines, ensuring a safe and effective recovery.
